subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01A7_01C9E83F.BBB51400
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yes, you are right. Sorry, I am just beginning to learn about this area of =
research. Everything omits radiation at different levels. 

What I should h=
ave said is that true EVP aren't produced via sound waves in the range of h=
uman hearing. But the fact that one recorder would pick up something and an=
other recorder just inches away would not does support the theory about it =
being transmitted right next to or directly on the electronics that write t=
o the media.

Sorry, my knowledge is very limited in this area so my terms =
may be incorrect or insufficient. Please correct me at will so I may learn =
all this properly.

April

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ra=
tka 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:38 PM
 =
 Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





        It sounds like she's saying =
"one, two, ....."

        A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking =
that there are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound=
 waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is fre=
quency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain=
 block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spe=
ctrum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic wav=
es can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter =
the wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.

        Think of =
microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave =
but the waves also have a physical effect on our environment by causing mol=
ecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or i=
nfrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just ca=
uses molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. I=
ts a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR rad=
iation.

        Frank R.

        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <a=
pril@...> wrote:


          From: April Abercromb=
ie <april@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ne=
w ideas [3 Attachments]
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Dat=
e: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM


          Here is some food for thought.=
 I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.

      =
    It was me and another girl teammate present in the room. I picked up a =
3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were=
 standing right next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside =
my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I hav=
e asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she pick=
ed it up.

          I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound=
 waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied vo=
ice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.

          Thi=
s instance with the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder =
should have picked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.=


          I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The file that is nam=
ed "01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip. You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah"=
, and then another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=

          Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear th=
is until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my on=
e's from the last investigation.


            ----- Original Message -----=
 
            From: Frank Ratka 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
=
            Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
            Subject: Re: [E=
VP-ITC] New ideas


                  I have a running theory that EVP is c=
arried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to =
manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic =
waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them=
 together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if =
a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room=
 creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediat=
e difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20=
KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultr=
asonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that=
 EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.

                 =
 We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyn=
e systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a=
 commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

  =
                Frank R.

                  --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup =
<w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


                    From: Zack Widup <w9sz.=
zack@gmail. com>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
     =
               To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                    Date: Monda=
y, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


                    Fascinating! I've had this i=
dea that the EVP are often not recorded by the microphone but somehow make =
their way in at the actual point where the storage is made, whether it be a=
nalog (tape) or digital. 

                    So much we don't know ...

 =
                   Zack

                     
                    On Mon, =
Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch.=
 com> wrote:




                      I monitor my audio live. The funny t=
hing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in =
the environment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon =
playback.

                        ----- Original Message ----- 
          =
              From: Zack Widup 
                        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups .com 
                        Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
   =
                     Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                   =
     I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ev=
er gotten any EVP in real time.

                        I took part in an =
investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We ha=
d six video cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video fo=
r all was being monitored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did =
not have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. =
I wonder what we might have heard if we did?

                        Zack
=

                         
                        On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1=
2:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:


       =
                 Let's just agree to end this discussion about her... 
    =
                    Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyon=
e have any new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
                        Al

=
